ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.controllers

Interface FController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FragmentController

    public interface FController
    Control of data in the Fragment model. Controls fragment modifications within the selected fragment. Allows the user to add, delete or edit an illustration, text or a choice to the current fragment.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FragmentPart addNewFragmentPart(Fragment fragment, java.lang.String type, int pos)
      Adds a new Fragment part of the given type to the FragmentPart list of the fragment.
      boolean deleteFragmentPart(Fragment fragment, int partNum)
      Tries to remove a fragment part at the given partNum.
      void removeEmptyPart(Fragment fragment)
      Removes the first occurrence of an empty FragmentPart, type = "e", in the FragmentPart list of fragment.
      void setFragmentPartChoice(Fragment fragment, FragmentPart part, Choice choice)
      Sets the choice field of a FragmentPart in the FragmentPart list of fragment.
      void setFragmentPartData(Fragment fragment, FragmentPart part, java.lang.String data)
      Sets the data field of a FragmentPart in the FragmentPart list of fragment.
      void setFragmentPartPicSize(Fragment fragment, FragmentPart part, int picSize)
      Sets the picSize field of a FragmentPart in the FragmentPart list of fragment.
      void setTitle(Fragment fragment, java.lang.String newTitle)
      Changes the title of the given fragment to the given title.

    • Method Detail

      • setTitle

        void setTitle(Fragment fragment,
            java.lang.String newTitle)
        Changes the title of the given fragment to the given title. There are no limits on the length of this title.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the fragment whose title we are changing
        newTitle - the new title of the fragment, must not be null

      • addNewFragmentPart

        FragmentPart addNewFragmentPart(Fragment fragment,
                              java.lang.String type,
                              int pos)
        Adds a new Fragment part of the given type to the FragmentPart list of the fragment.
        Parameters:
        fragment - to add the FragmentPart to
        type - is the type of FragmentPart to add, should be "t" (text), "i" (illustration), "c" (choice), or "e" (empty)
        pos - is the position to insert the FragmentPart in the FragmentPart list of fragment
        Returns:
        FragmentPart the newly created FragmentPart
        See Also:
        FragmentPart

      • setFragmentPartData

        void setFragmentPartData(Fragment fragment,
                       FragmentPart part,
                       java.lang.String data)
        Sets the data field of a FragmentPart in the FragmentPart list of fragment. Should only be used on "t" (text) or "i" (illustration) type FragmentParts.
        Parameters:
        fragment - Fragment that owns the given FragmentPart, part
        part - the FragmentPart to modify
        data - the new data to be set for part, must not be null
        See Also:
        FragmentPart

      • setFragmentPartChoice

        void setFragmentPartChoice(Fragment fragment,
                         FragmentPart part,
                         Choice choice)
        Sets the choice field of a FragmentPart in the FragmentPart list of fragment. Should only be used on "c" (choice) type FragmentParts.
        Parameters:
        fragment - Fragment that owns the given FragmentPart, part
        part - the FragmentPart to modify
        choice - the new choice to be set for part, must not be null
        See Also:
        FragmentPart

      • setFragmentPartPicSize

        void setFragmentPartPicSize(Fragment fragment,
                          FragmentPart part,
                          int picSize)
        Sets the picSize field of a FragmentPart in the FragmentPart list of fragment. Should only be used on "i" (illustration) type FragmentParts.
        Parameters:
        fragment - Fragment that owns the given FragmentPart, part
        part - the FragmentPart to modify
        picSize - the new picSize to be set for part, must not be null
        See Also:
        FragmentPart

      • deleteFragmentPart

        boolean deleteFragmentPart(Fragment fragment,
                         int partNum)
        Tries to remove a fragment part at the given partNum. If there is no part at this partNum, we will return false and perform no deletions. If there is a fragment part at this partNum we will delete it return true.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the fragment to delete the choice from
        partNum - the position of the fragment part to delete
        Returns:
        true if the choice was deleted, otherwise false

      • removeEmptyPart

        void removeEmptyPart(Fragment fragment)
        Removes the first occurrence of an empty FragmentPart, type = "e", in the FragmentPart list of fragment. If there are no empty parts nothing is deleted.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the fragment to remove the empty part from.
        See Also:
        FragmentPart
